q66E-V9iggB2W1wlffW6oQ.text: 3/12/2018 Yelp review Oregano's Pizza Bistro Tempe AZ 523 W University Dr, Tempe, AZ 85281 (480) 858-0501  Whenever I stop by an Oregano's Pizza Bistro whether it be the Tempe, Sedona, or Phoenix location I always have high expectations when it comes to their quality of food, pricing, overall atmosphere, and customer service. I go to Oregano's pretty often compared to other options, actually enjoying it so much that I went there for my last birthday because it's one of my favorite restaurants.  The food at Oregano's Pizza Bistro is unrivaled, I have yet to hear of a worthy competitor when it comes to their Italian food; the basis of most if not all of their menu options. I most commonly order the Zany Ziti. This mouthwatering dish is a large pasta bread bowl topped in prime meat sauce, Italian cheeses, a pinch of oregano, and a piece of garlic bread on the side. I have yet to be disappointed by this dish; the consistency of how exquisite it tastes along with it always brought hot and fresh to my table will continually bring me back for many years to come. Not to mention kind waiters offering an abundance of additional parmesan cheese which they drizzle over your food right before diving into your Italian pasta that has become so familiar to me. However along with the delicious pasta dishes, Oregano's Pizza Bistro also offers wings, salads, pizza, and sandwiches. These however I can't speak on since I only go to Oregano's specifically for the outstanding pasta. In addition to the amazing food, if you're looking to eat out and not break the bank then you're in luck. Although prices vary most commonly between 7 to 20 dollars you will be met with an abundance of high quality food which I find myself in most cases having to get a to-go box anyways to finish the next day. Unlike food chains that are sub 5 dollar range you will be met with low grade ingredients and mediocre customer service.  Walking into an Oregano's Pizza Bistro alone is a soothing experience. The aroma of succulent food pollutes the air while generous waiters welcome you in.  Every one of their locations I have been to also look similar internally and externally. The overall aesthetic this restaurant goes for is an old school style that has emphasis on decorations such as televisions, pictures, lighting, wood, and others. This type of atmosphere really boosts the overall experience and compliments the already delicious food effortlessly.   Last but not least in order for any restaurant to succeed they must provide exceptional customer service. Time and time again I am always met with happy and polite employees which really sets the mood for the whole eating experience. Waiters will come back multiple times throughout eating a meal making sure everyone is satisfied on drinks, food, and the temptation of ordering additional sides or dessert. In the end whenever I choose to eat out at Oregano's Pizza Bistro I can always rely on them providing me high quality Italian food at an affordable price, a unique environment, and astounding customer service.

LUFpj5oWztrGqBVcYehm2w.text: Shitty service, manager not helpful at all. Waited around for my order for lasagna for over 40 min to find out they never put the order in. Ridiculous

kqeXcFigfe72gECYFBjExw.text: I don't know why I always have bad luck at Organos.  First off they have pepsi but they used to have great green tea so I agreed to go.  No more.  Sorry it was voted out.  Ok so I tried a passion fruit tea.  I drink green because it's supposed to be healthy.  But no big deal it wasn't bad.  We had great service.  Very nice young female.  Good sense of humor too.  We ordered.  She was helpful there.  I looked through yelp and found something that l couldn't live with out.  The girl ordered a chicken parm sandwich.  I noticed waffle fries so she switched out the chips.  She was very happy.  I got the Lady Shrimp Scampi.  I love fussilli pasta and shrimp.  It came out cold.  I mean the pasta was actually cold.  The shrimp looked under cooked.  Not crispy and plump like the photo someone had posted.  The waitress came and apologized.  She said is the pasta really cold.  I felt another peace and sure enough it was cold.  I said maybe I should get something else.  But she took it back and had them fix it.  Mean while I enjoyed a few waggle fries from the girl.  Her sandwich I have to say was very good.  The chicken was cooked perfect.  Crispy and juicy still.  The garlic break roll was warm and also perfect not over cooked or old or anything like my awful pasta.  They bring out another one but I have to say I'm pretty sure the cook just stuck it in the microwave because the sauce was now gross.  The shrimp still looked pathetic and pasta was chewy.  So I asked to order something else.  I got the anti pasta salad.  It came out and it was not bad.  IT's annoying how they load so much on there because my artichoke rolled off the plate and on to the floor.  But they give a few.  The issue here is that the tomato was chopped and few times I got tastes of rotten tomato.  And my tea.  Well by now it was 10pm and the other server dumped them all out.  I asked to try black but that was gone too.  So my rotten salad had to go with a water.  And that's my story.  But let's just think about this for one second.  The cook sent out a pasta dish with cold pasta.  It was actually cold to the touch.  I looked at it and could tell the shrimp didn't look right.  It's common to get shrimp that seems under cooked.  I think some cooks see it curled so they take it off the grill.  But you want to cook that shrimp so it has flavor.  This is why scampi is one of the best Shrimp dishes.  But then don't send it out tasting like it was microwaved.  But let's be honest the real crime here is the manager who didn't rush over to apologize.  She did come over and kind of mumbled I'm sorry about the ice tea I'll take that off your check.  Obviously you can't charge me for ice tea if I'm drinking water.  But if you care that much about customers being served cold pasta you don't care about training the cooks to make the food properly.  And you also wouldn't have them send out salad with rotten tomatoes.  Maybe offer a free desert or something.  What I probably should have done was just leave and gone home and ate instead of them having to make food for me now when they are supposed to be closed.  Obviously they aren't going to care at that point they want to go home.  But don't compensate customers who are there an hour now still waiting for diner . At least my girl enjoyed her chicken parm sandwich.  It was good.  But I'm not sure how I can ever go back there.  Having a nice server isn't enough.  There are 100 other places in Tempe to eat.   I used to really like Oreganos when they first opened in Scottsdale while I was in college it was one of my favorite places to go.  It's a shame.

juBtQFymqtUpocpfmkOjkg.text: Great food and great customer service! I was introduced to Oregano's by my sister's a few years ago and now everytime I come to the Phoenix area I have to make a stop for their deep dish pizza. This was my families first time visiting and they were satified with their food as I was my first time. I recommend this place.

MjcAHIpjmJptB_I2sIWcfQ.text: The food was excellent. We did takeout so we cannot comment on the dining in.  The foot was hot when we got it.  The server offered us plates, utensils, parm cheese.  We got the baked pasta in the bread bowl. We split it and it was enough food.  Medium price range, worth it.

2NT4btWqQek6bN7bDVke_A.text: Pretty average, at best.   Im I the only one that finds stereotypical Italian American food, set with a stupid corny Italian "EHHHYY BABBADII BOP" themed menu annoying? Maybe that's because I grew up in an Italian neighborhood in NY... This place is a joke, and a flat, unflavored one.   45-60 min wait for a 10 inch deep dish?? (For the boyfriend, I'd never go against NY thin crust tradition) WUZZAMADDA WIT YOU! (Oreganos feel free to use my amazing authentic Italian catch phrase. It was the only one you didn't use on your menu.   Wtf is an Italian place doing having guacamole and quesadillas ...  ?!   The thin crust was very floppy and greasy - signs their oven isn't hot enough and the cheese is low quality. The chicken parm was okay. Standard Disneyland quality IMO.   Idk man go to downtown Phoenix or somethings - pay the money and go to Pizzaria Bianco or Tratto. Don't settle for this BS. MAMA MIA !!!

XMYxoyJ8LjfjRO7v9C6jCw.text: We're visiting from Los Angeles and were looking for a good place to eat so we came here and let me tell you that From beginning to end this experience was absolutely PERFECT! The food was great and the service was flawless, our waitress "Kelsey" was very nice and knowledgeable.  My son says this has to be the best Pizza on earth!!!! Great job.....we'll be back! The Hernandez family from Los Angeles! ***GO DODGERS*** :-)

3N5iv1YBypyUkh0kcIcyAA.text: I've admitted in the past.  OPB is not my favorite place in the world to wine and dine.  I find it to be ordinary. I only go when a clueless friend or colleague decides it's the spot to meet at.  This time, I have to say, it wasn't so bad.  Don't get me wrong, it's a good eatery for other people...it just does not meet my dining style. I had the Mom's Sausage and Peppers plate...Yum! But I won't be going back until another clueless friend or colleague suggests it's the place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mom&#39;s sausage and pepper

ck-gYjP3coOsEwFxvHiPgQ.text: No management or visible manager at all.  Inexperienced children working take out a complete waste of time. Foods decent and it's a shame this is clearly a rudderless ship !

N_1Sdj8dzeZ6ZqHNSLFKBQ.text: My go to pizzeria in Phoenix. Reminds me of Lou Malnatis deep dish pie in Chicago. They use quality ingredients.

YjrsX7I6tmElwYtjb11ayA.text: We came on a Saturday night and there was a small crowd waiting outside.  We didn't have to wait too long to get a table inside though.  Really cute, but small place.  Our waiter was really friendly and rattled off some recommendations. We split a caesar salad and a baked ziti.  It was served inside a crust bowl.  Really interesting.  It was hard as a rock and didn't have a lot of flavor. The real star was the desert- salted caramel cookie with ice cream. He said they like to feed you, and he wasn't lying. We were stuffed and I can't even imagine finishing an entree on my own. The portions were huge. I'd definitely choose a different main dish next time, but the service was really top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Baked Ziti with cold, hard garlic bread
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salted caramel cookie- look at all that ice cream!

Hv3INdhDN4iWubJ4MXw6sA.text: Oh helllll yesss.  Deep dish pizza unlike any you have EVER experienced.  Sprint, don't walk, to Oregano's Pizza Bistro. I go to the Tempe OPB.  Yep. Forget Chicago and NYC.  You'll need a life jacket in order to survive in this sea of buttery, cheesy, sweet and salty deep dish pizza.   I travel a lot, and when I'm in the Phoenix area, I ALWAYS eat at Oreganos.  Creature of habit? Yes, so I always get the Kale Caesar salad prior to the main show.   This is a HUGE salad loaded with fresh kale and topped with some killer fresh ingredients, including shredded parmesan, raisins and almonds.  The flavor killer.  BAM.  After the salad comes the main event - deep dish sausage pizza.  OMG!!!!!  You'll need to take a bucket or something to contain the drool flowing from your mouth.  The pizza is indescribably rich with cheese, butter, sausage and onion.  And the crust?  *GASP*.  Makes me weak in the knees to talk about.  Decadent.  I douse my pizza with additional Parmesan cheese and, of course, oregano!!  Like most of my meals, I drink it with a big ole' glass of milk (quit your eye rolling).  Could I get it in a sippy cup?    The service is topnotch.  Very prompt, friendly and attentive staff.    I've not tried much else because, as I mentioned above, I am a creature of habit.   Working on this so I can provide the most complete and diverse reviews.  5 stars for sure!    Happy eating and traveling!

8DtMNDor_Ji7kEs7rBRmRA.text: We found this spot based on the good reviews on yelp. Well that was misleading. There was a short wait but we were seated quickly. I ordered a drink and he ordered a cider. The drinks came out quick and were good, however my drinks was just lemonade I think.  We ordered a flat pizza because the deep dish takes an hour to get ready. I also ordered the stuffed mushrooms as appetizer. The appetizer was actually 2 huge caps covered with shredded beef, tomatoes, cheese... it was good but not warm enough. The pizza came out fast and it was absolutely terrible. Gladly I had the appetizer because the pizza was inedible. Chewy, no flavor, dried out, weird detached dry elastic type crust. Worst pizza ever. Bad choice for dinner. Service was good but that's about it. Plenty of parking space around the restaurant is good too.

fkwtBmf9d1rp_XUsrReWjA.text: Extremely unhappy with our service today. Went here for lunch in between work and ended up getting our food to go because after 45 min, it still wasn't ready and we were going to be late getting back to work. After the waitress brought us our check and we paid, we waited a little longer and then finally got up and went towards the front to let our waitress we really had to go. The waitress was pleased and kind, apologetic and got the manager for us. When the manager came outside, she said are food was almost out and I expressed to her very kindly that we had been waiting almost an hour and couldn't wait much longer. Her exact response to me was and I quote" your ticket says 23 min" with an attitude ! Basically saying, your full of it and just being impatient. I told it "well it should say 40 min, because that's how long we waited".  and guess what! lol we're still waiting. We didn't ask for a discount and we were never rude, yet this manager offered nothing! Not even an apology. Instead I was given attitude and treated like I was just being impatient. The waitress offered to take my number down and call me later to discuss the issue. I also ordered my Brussel sprouts to be simply steamed and that's it. No oil or cheese. And yet they are drenched in oil. That was my experience with this location and it's very apparent that the manager working today needs a class on how to deal with customers.   Update ! 9/6/2019 I have still not received the gift card I was offered due to my experience at this location. The manager called me and was very kind, very apologetic, offered to send me a gift card but I have yet to receive it.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

kaZ2qy_BV91RYm5zni7Cuw.text: I would usually give Oreganos a 5 star rating as I have been to many location plenty of times and the Pizza is outstanding. Another reason we come is for the Pizza Cookie. As always the pizza was fantastic. The service was slower than usual but the worse thing was that this delicious cookie we came for was burnt and tasted burnt. We told the waitress that hthe cookie was burnt and she nicely told us she would tell the cook. Oreganos being the quality pizza house that they are should of offered to take the burnt  cookie off the bill.   After writing my original review the company Oreganos did ask me to write them an e-mail to further discuss the issue. I wrote them as they requested with no response.  Oreganos wrote me back and made everything right by providing the customer service that I am use to from there establishment. Once again this is my favorite place to eat pizza as it is the best tasting one I have run into. I appreciate the follow up customer service which indicates a business truly cares for their customers.

5THxyZs1xOaNytIiqqEwfw.text: Five stars are not enough...Dee The amazing bartender server is a dynamo personality, service and making you welcome. she was able to anticipate our needs met them before we asked.    No need to travel to the Druery cold of Chicago. for the best "Chicago" pizza, come here enjoy the beautiful women and wonderful atmosphere in Tempe Arizona!!!!   The manager was very attentive and checking on every table to make sure the quality and standards were not compromised.

h68hNLE0McjB-R3iyk5Feg.text: I've been going to oregano is for years and years and I've always loved it because it's so much fun. The pizza is always great even the garlic bread is great. And pretty much everything else is great. But my favorite has always been the decadent desserts. If you can't love those desserts you can't love anything.  The service is always pretty darn good and I've never gone there without having a great time.

ITLnO2BufaXurHGe9FAMcw.text: I've been to a few Oregano's over the past few years, but I think this is my first review, and my first at this Tempe location. The food is always good here. The parking lot is somewhat small, and it was full when we my son and I left at 7pm. Get there early. I had the sausage sandwich with sauteed onions and mushrooms. A very sizeable dish. I only ate half. My son ordered the chicken parm on top of pasta. A big portion size on a platter. We had the calamari - but would pass on that next time. Not sure it was frozen, but all the calamari looked the same size and no tentacles. Most likely? The cookie and ice cream desert was good, but I the cookie was too gooey, too soft. Next time I will ask for well done. Anyway, the food was delicious. Service was great. Managers checked on us. That's the usual at Oregano's. I like going there. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sausage sandwich. Just the right amount of spice in it. Sizeable sandwich for $9.99.

6_N89dCiWLXtAiNwS9QDxA.text: Bottom line up front:  this place does it right both with great service AND quality food .....on a weekday .....at 3 PM!!   my entire family has been in the restaurant business for 30 years, Sullivan behind the bar was unreal, his recommendations and service were on point!  he could've just been a regular guy/lame bartender but instead he went over the top, and then the food comes ........it's out of this world, fresh, flavorful, big portions with all the trimmings.    and all of the staff were talking about training, about shifts, and about things to get better when there was no one in the restaurant and they could've just been flaking out and fkkng off .....so glad to experience and enjoy it all!   highly recommend this location, period.

TEtOC41iXxHCW_Cn7OBs_w.text: I've been going to this place off an on for around 8 years. The staff is always friendly. Lunch prices are great and the food is enjoyable.  Sullivan is a great bartender and attentive to his customers. He always go above and beyond to make the customers feel special...well at least I do.

XyfM4diErahaT1E-qcb4sQ.text: I honestly am amazed that this is one of the highest rated Oregano's. First, I would like to start by saying I love their food. However, I struggle with the service at this location. My Oregano's of choice is the one in Mesa off Southern Ave and Dobson based off of service and food. I have been in to the Tempe location a couple of times during Midday Lunch Rush, which I would assume means, lunch portions and quick service to get you back to that 9-5p... not here. My party came at 12p and by the time we left it was close to 1:30p. I don't know about a lot of other businesses in the area but this is not a lunch friendly establishment if I have to be here for an hour and a half.   Upon arrival, we checked in with the hostess who gave a lot of attitude and did not come off friendly at all even to the party in front of us. We were seated very shortly after the party before us as well. We opted to sit outside due to a shorter wait time. Our server Cierra was nice, however she came took our drink orders, brought our drinks, took our lunch orders and disappeared for 40 minutes. Not once was our drinks checked on or were we updated on our food status. ------- I am sorry, but if I have to sit outside in the 101 degree Arizona heat, someone should be constantly checking to make sure everyone is staying hydrated. Proper hydration can put people in better moods, which would probably help when the food is taking a while. We watched the table who got seated just before us receive their drinks, salads, lunch AND dessert before our food came. Their group size doesn't matter in comparison to ours, they had just about the same amount of people but twice the amount of food. When the food arrived, my coworker got her salad probably 30 minutes before the actual meal when she specifically asked they come together. I got the Big Rig and my noodles were cold, but at that point it was either suck it up and eat them, or complain and risk taking a even longer lunch. Then to make it worse, we were trying to pay quickly to leave and getting our checks took a while, but cashing out took even longer. I'm just frustrated, and honestly the attitudes that I received didn't make me feel comfortable. I don't know if it's the heat, but I probably won't be returning to this Oregano's any time in the near future.

3NvFgNKZga_M0xLFRfBdVQ.text: Stopped here after picking up my wife's new passport - as it was just down a few blocks. We dine at Oregano's often and its one of our favourite places for pizza. This place is smaller than the one in Scottsdale (close to us) but just as good. Our server was awesome and looked after us very well. We shared our fav pizza (Numero Uno) and some wings.. and had a beer. Was always going to be a good expereince - love Oregano's.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

O0QQsKUlaETW2XJqC9bcIg.text: I often stop by Oreganos monthly as they have a great Chicago Italian style menu and great service. If it's a hit day, I recommend the frozen Bellini. It's a house specialty of a mixture of Chianti, Triple Sec, peach schnapps, pineapple juice, and s fee other secret ingredients. They also have a beer on tap, in bottles and on draft as well as a full bar.   This is a fun place to sit at the bar solo, enjoy a high top with a special someone or snag a booth or patio table with the family.   You can't go wrong with any of the thin crust pizzas, pastas, or salads. A favorite of mine is the Mac and cheese, Vini bambino salad, wings and calamari. The cheese bread is also the size of a boat. Make sure to bring your appetite as nothing here is small because they cater to family portions.   Week night evenings are easy to get in; however, Friday and Saturday nights you should expect a wait. But don't worry as it's well worth it.   For dessert, end the night with a tasty pazookie. A tasty pizza cookie cooked to perfection as to not be too crispy with a top of ice cream. You also have many selections to choose from and like their pizzas can go half and half without hesitation.

9PWr5ia2MVkKSUf7YGyXhA.text: Great place!! Pasta was perfectly cooked and sauce just right. Calamari was delicious. Thick slices of fresh and  not chewy calamari. Cute atmosphere.   Nice wine selection.  This Northeasterner was more than pleasantly surprised! Will definitely be back on my next visit Phoenix.

eZ_lQrtWVrPCv2esgKGvTw.text: Never to return to this location. Management and staff on weekend is the rudest bunch ever. Use to love this place, but won't ever go back. If you fit the look beware.

USmrnNDbvEhC5oFONurk9g.text: Fun place, great staff and pizzas! Drinks were made fantastic... margaritas were good and strong ... pizza with thin crust was delish.

rlVyUAkh7jGTrjp3TA7tTg.text: We love eating a Oregano's the food and a beverages are always great.  I just to do a better job planning so that I don't have a long wait to get seated.

nwEk8uvEOLWr_pyqMG1KFQ.text: Came in here yesterday and was told the pan pizza was going to take 45 min I said okay I can wait that's fine. Ended up taking over an hour and when it came out it was the nastiest pizza I've ever tried and could barely finish a slice. The server gave me a free pazookie to make up for it but the bill was still $24 for a gross pizza and for being there for over and hour and a half. The server was nice but literally could not balance multiple things at once. I'm so pissed. Never coming back.

8I1Do2X8KiE-Vf984u03-Q.text: I am absolutely flabbergasted that this bistro is rated so high. I pulled in and found that parking was extremely tight but was able to pull into a spot as another left. I saw many people were waiting for seats and was glad that I was doing a to go order. It was a mix of families as well as many college students as its only 100 yards or so from the university.  I walked in through the back door and navigated to the front of the restaurant where I sat at the bar and placed a to go order for a pepperoni Chicago style deep dish pizza, about $19 for a 10". The gal informed me it would take about 45 to 50 minutes so that I could leave and come back or just hang out.   Once I got back, parking was nearly impossible. I had to drive around for a good 15 minutes and parked about 1/4 mile away in another parking lot running in so I wouldnt get towed. Since this is a university area, all parking (even neighborhood), are private or blocked off. Once I went in the gal was just as nice and gave me my pizza which smelled pretty darn good.  Once I got back to my hotel I opened the box and saw the grease laced pizza calling out to me "eat me, eat me!". Oh shit, I was about to make love to this pizza, I thought. I love chicago style pizza and its rare to find a good one outside of Chicago (Tonys Little Italy in Placentia CA is an exception). I grabbed a slice by the base making sure to cradle the back as it began to sink a bit from the weight of this meaty monstrosity. I could feel the warmth as it got close to my lips and wrapped my mouth around it. William H effing Macy was that thing salty. I focused on what was in my mouth and felt some grease leaking out as I hesitantly swallowed it.   Enough with the suggestive descriptions. But I was shocked! This thing was so damn salty I couldnt believe it! I took another bite and again, this was bad. I grabbed the utensils placing the slice down and did some science biting into the bread. The bread was soft but I dont care for bread too much so moved on. The cheese and sauce, a bit salty but not what I had tasted before. It was then that I took a bit of some pepperoni (which there is a lot of) and holy crap I had to close my eyes as it was nearly unbearable. I repeated the process finding the exact same thing.   The pepperoni was overly salty. combined with the sauce and cheese made for combination that could stop hearts. I ended up throwing over half of it away and not even saving it as I had expected too as it was probably the WORST Chicago style deep dish I have ever had. The only saving grace was the service as that was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States. Take out deep dish pepperoni
Photo of Oregano's Pizza Bistro - Tempe, AZ, United States

G0nqssbzGRePWqNr5V6v1g.text: This place is so cute!!  The atmosphere is awesome and the food was just as good! We ordered the Numerone-o, cesar salad, and deep dish.  They warned us in advance that the deep dish takes a whole to cook.  It was worth the wait.  They also mistakenly made is the wrong pizza and gave it to us anyways.  It was a meat lovers dream thin crust pizza.  We will for sure visit here again the next time we are in town!
